Judul: DESAIN IN SILICO INHIBITOR HEPATOCYTE GROWTH FACTOR RECEPTOR BERBASIS SENYAWA ALAM INDONESIA DARI TUMBUHAN DIPTEROCARPACEAE
Abstrak: Hepatocyte Growth Factor Receptor (HGFR) is a transmembrane protein that have function as signal transducer. Autophosphorylation at HGFRÃ‚Â’s tyrosin kinase domain activates signal transducing causing cancer metastasis. The aim of this research is using in silico approach to design new inhibitor HGFRÃ‚Â’s tyrosin kinase from IndonesiaÃ‚Â’s natural compound found in Dipterocarpaceae plants. HGFR binding energy of nine compounds (log P < 5) from 32 IndonesiaÃ‚Â’s natural compound is prodicted using molecular docking software, AutoDock Vina. The result shows that Diptoindonesin G (DIG) is compound with lowest binding energy (-11.0 kcal/mol). New compound (DG2) is designed by replacement of one DIGÃ‚Â’s hidroxyl group with methyl group. DG2Ã‚Â’s binding energy is -11.5 kcal/mol as shown by molecular docking result. Molecular dynamic simulation (2 ns) of DIG-HGFR and DG2-HGFR complexes shows binding energy change of both compounds. Weaker DIG binding energy of -8,76 kcal/mol is observed. In the other hand, stronger DG2 binding energy of -11,99 kcal/mol is observed. Ligand-receptor interaction analysis after 2 ns shows that HGFR-DG2 complex assumes inactive conformation as observed at HGFR-ARQ197 complex. Interaction beetwen DG2/ARQ197 with Arg1227 is critical in stabilization of inactive conformation. However, DG2 and ARQ197 has different mode of interaction. ARQ197 interact with Arg1227 hydrophobicly, whereas DG2 forms hydrogen bonding with Arg1227. From similiarity of HGFR inactive conformation standpoint, DG2 is predicted to has similar inhibition characteristic and mechanism with ARQ197.
